intro: Psychotria valetoniana, commonly known as the Valetonian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but have a mild, somewhat bitter taste. Psychotria valetoniana is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and secondary growth areas.
